v.v: Then Yahweh spoke to Job from inside a powerful storm. He said to him,
“Who are you to bring confusion to what I plan to do?
I want to ask you some questions,
Where were you when I started to create the earth?
If it was not I who decided how large the earth would be, then who decided?
What supports the pillars on which the earth rests?
When the seas poured out from under the earth,
It was I, not you, who caused clouds to come over the seas
I set limits for the seas,
I pointed to the shore and said to the water,
Job, have you ever commanded the morning to begin?
Have you ever told the dawn to spread out over the whole earth
When it becomes light after the dawn,
When it becomes daylight, the wicked do not have the darkness that they like;
Job, have you traveled to the springs in the bottom of the ocean from which the water in the seas comes?
Has someone shown you the gates to the place where dead people are,
Do you know how big the earth is?
Where is the road to the place where light comes from?
Can you take the light and the darkness to the places where they must do their work every day?
I am sure that you know these things
Have you entered the place where I store the snow
I store the snow and the hail in order that I can use them when people are fighting on earth,
Where is the road to the place from which I cause the lightning to flash?
Who created the channels in which the rain comes down from the sky?
Who causes rain to fall in the desert,
Who sends the rain that gives moisture to barren areas, areas where nothing has grown,
Does the rain have a father?
From whose womb does ice come in the winter?
In the winter, the water freezes and becomes as hard as a rock,
Job, can you fasten the chains that hold the stars together in the cluster of the Pleiades stars?
Can you tell the stars and planets when they should shine?
Do you know the laws that the stars must obey?
Can you shout commands up to the clouds and make rain pour down on you?
Can you cause flashes of lightning to come down and strike where you want them to strike?
Who enables the clouds to know when they should cause rain to fall?
Who is skilled enough to be able to count the clouds?
so that the dry ground becomes hard
When a lioness and her cubs crouch in their dens or hide in a thicket, waiting for some animal to pass by that they can kill,
Who provides dead animals for the raven,
“Job, do you know at what time of the year the female mountain goats give birth?
Do you know how many months pass from the time they become pregnant until their calves are born?
When they give birth, they crouch down,
The young calves grow up in the open fields,
Who allows the wild donkeys to go wherever they want away from the cities?
I am the one who has freed them and put them in the desert plain,
They do not like the noise in the cities;
They go over the hills to find food;
Will a wild ox agree to work for you?
Can you fasten a rope on it
Since it is very strong, can you for that reason trust it to work for you?
Can you rely on it to come back from the field
Think also about the ostriches. They joyfully flap their wings,
Ostriches lay their eggs on top of the ground and then walk away,
Ostriches never think about the possibility that some wild animal may step on the eggs and crush them.
Ostriches act cruelly toward their chicks;
That is because I did not allow ostriches to be wise.
However, when they get up and begin to run,
Also, think about horses. Job, are you the one who made the horses to be strong?
Are you the one who enabled them to leap forward like locusts?
They paw the ground, rejoicing because they are very strong,
It is as if they were laughing at the thought of being afraid. They are not afraid of anything!
The quivers containing the riders’ arrows rattle against the horses’ sides,
The horses run very quickly, and they speedily cover the ground;
They neigh joyfully when they hear someone blowing the trumpet.
Think about big birds. Are you the one who enabled hawks to spread their wings
Do eagles fly high up into the cliffs to make their nests
They live in holes in those cliffs.
As they watch carefully from there,
After an eagle kills an animal,

v: You are speaking ignorantly!
so act like a man and
get ready to answer my questions.
Since you know so much, tell me where you were at that time.
Do you know who stretched a line around the earth to measure it?
Since you think that you know so much, you should surely know that!
When the stars that shine early in the morning sang together,
and someone put in place the stone that causes the earth to stay in its place,
and all the angels shouted joyfully when they saw that happen,
who laid that cornerstone?
who prevented the water from flooding over the land?
and caused it to become very dark under those clouds.
and I put barriers so that the water would not come over the land.
‘I permit you to come up to here, but I do not permit you to come any farther.
Your powerful waves must stop here!’
Have you ever told the sun to start rising and begin a new day?
with the result that wicked people run away from the light?
the hills and the valleys become clear like a seal gives an image to the clay under it, or like the folds in a cloth.
in the daylight they no longer are able to hurt anyone.
Have you investigated the very bottom of the oceans?
the gates to the place where it is very dark among those who are dead?
Tell me, if you know all these things!
Can you tell me where darkness lives?
Do you know where the road is that goes back to their homes?
because you were born before the time when all things were created;
you must be very old!
and the place where I keep the hail?
in times when they are fighting wars.
Where is the place from where the east wind begins to blow over all the earth?
Who makes the roads for the thunder in the air?
in places where no one lives?
so that grass begins to grow again?
Does the dew also have a father?
Who gives birth to the frost that comes down from the sky?
and the surface of lakes becomes frozen.
Can you unfasten the cords of the stars in Orion?
Can you guide the stars in the groups of the Big Bear and the Little Bear?
Can you cause those same laws to rule everything here on the earth?
Do those flashes say to you, ‘Where do you want us to strike?’
Who can tilt the containers of water in the sky to cause the rain to fall
as the dry clods become wet and stick together?
can you find animals for the lioness to kill
so that she and her cubs can eat the meat and not be hungry anymore?
when its young are calling out to me for food,
when they are so weak because of their lack of food that they stagger around in their nests?
